title.narrative: LEGAL AND NORMATIVE FRAMEWORK

description.narrative: Responsible national and sub-national entities have increased capacity to enact and operationalize implementation of the legal and normative framework aligned with international child rights conventions and child protection standards., which contributes to Prevention Of Harmful Practice, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: CHILD PROTECTION outcome: Girls and boys vulnerable and exposed to violence, abuse and exploitation are better protected by institutional (formal and informal) and legislative frameworks which include services and systems.

related-activity.ref: 0060/A0/07/885 PROTECTION FROM ABUSE, VIOLENCE AND EXPL

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Responsible national and sub-national entities have increased capacity to enact and operationalize implementation of the legal andnormative framework aligned with international child rights conventions and child protection standards.

description.narrative: With UNICEF technical support, three significant national policies on child protection and safeguarding were endorsed which improved protection systems at national and regional levels.; Moreover, the Protection of the Child Rights Law was enforced with the support of the High Commission of Child Rights and the 2nd Vice President, followed by endorsement of comprehensive training packages for justice actors. However, these gains were threatened with the recent events post 15th August. UNICEF is working with partners on advocacy to sustain the achievements and increasing the capacity of community-based mechanisms, CPAN and NGOs to improve the informal child protection system. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:12/01/2022

title.narrative: Key articles of the CRC (Articles 19, 34, 38) dealing with violence exploitation and abuse included in draft national legislation(63400), Text
